battle

Class Fighter

  • java.lang.Object
    • battle.Fighter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Fighter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Actor
    Participates in battles as a member of a squad. Can apply statuses to other Fighter objects, or itself, by executing skills with the objective to defeat all enemy fighters.
    Author:
    Andrew M. Teller(https://github.com/AndrewMiTe)

      • Fighter

        public Fighter(java.lang.String name,
               Squad squad,
               java.util.List<Skill> skillList,
               int closeRange,
               java.util.function.BiPredicate<Fighter,Fighter> isAllyCase,
               java.util.function.BiPredicate<Fighter,Fighter> isEnemyCase,
               java.util.List<FighterHandler> listeners)
        Initializes the object so that all internal field variables that can be explicitly set are done so through the given parameters. See the FighterBuilder class which allows you to create Fighter objects using a builder pattern.

        name - FighterBuilder#setName
        squad - FighterBuilder#setSquad
        skillList - FighterBuilder#addSkill
        closeRange - FighterBuilder#setCloseRange
        isAllyCase - FighterBuilder#setIsAllyCase
        isEnemyCase - FighterBuilder#setIsEnemyCase
        listeners - FighterBuilder#addListener

      • applyStatus

        public boolean applyStatus(Status status)
        Attempts to apply the given Status object to the fighter. Returns true if the predicate for its application returned true.
        Parameters:
        status - status to be applied.
        Returns:
        true if the status was applied.

      • removeStatus

        public boolean removeStatus(Status status)
        Attempts to remove the given Status object from the fighter. Returns true if the object was both found and if the predicate for its removal returned true. This method will only remove the Status object given.
        Parameters:
        status - the status to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the status was removed.
        See Also:
        removeStatus(String name)

      • removeStatus

        public boolean removeStatus(java.lang.String name)
        Attempts to remove from the fighter any Status object with a name property matching the given String. Returns true if a match was both found and if the predicate for its removal returned true.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the status to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the status was removed.

      • getStatus

        public Status getStatus(Status status)
        Returns a Status object applied to the fighter with a matching name property to the given Status.
        Parameters:
        status - status with matching name of the status to be found.
        Returns:
        matching status object. Null if no match was found.

      • getStatus

        public Status getStatus(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a Status object with a matching name to the given String if one has been applied to the the fighter.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the status to be found.
        Returns:
        matching status object. Null if no match was found.
